content: little dexter dexter was made to look like my daughter s sweet old guy colors can be changed to fit your preferences materials 4 5mm hook safety eyes - i used 30mm because i wanted the big eye look for him black safety nose worsted weight yarn - in white black and light brown worked in the round head and body are worked in one piece muzzle - first round in black 1 single_crochet 8 into magic_ring - switch to white on last stitch - tie short ends together 2 increase x2 single_crochet 2 increase x2 single_crochet 2 12 3 single_crochet increase x3 single_crochet 3 increase x3 single_crochet 2 18 4 single_crochet 2 increase x3 single_crochet 6 increase x3 single_crochet 4 24 5 increase single_crochet 3 around 30 6-10 single_crochet around 5r of 30 11 single_crochet 6 slip_stitch into next fo leave tail for sewing the increases are the sides of the muzzle - safety nose goes into the first round of the white at the top of the black head/body - in white 1 single_crochet 6 into magic_ring 2 increase around 12 3 increase single_crochet around 18 4 increase single_crochet 2 around 24 5 increase single_crochet 3 around 30 6 increase single_crochet 4 around 36 7 increase single_crochet 5 around 42 8 increase single_crochet 6 around 48 9 increase single_crochet 7 around 54 10-19 single_crochet around 10r of 54 20 decrease single_crochet 7 around 48 21 decrease single_crochet 6 around 42 22 single_crochet around 42 23 decrease single_crochet 5 around 36 24 single_crochet around 36 25 decrease single_crochet 4 around 30 26 single_crochet around 30 stop here - stuff muzzle & sew to head top of muzzle at round 12 of the head - safety eyes are placed between rounds 10 & 11 about 9 stitches apart on each side of the muzzle continue with main pattern - 27-31 single_crochet around 5r of 30 stuff head 32 increase single_crochet 4 around 36 33-37 single_crochet around 5r of 36 38 increase single_crochet 5 around 42 39-44 single_crochet around 6r of 42 45 decrease single_crochet 5 around 36 46 decrease single_crochet 4 around 30 47 decrease single_crochet 3 around 24 stuff most of body 48 decrease single_crochet 2 around 18 49 decrease single_crochet around 12 finish stuffing body 50 decrease around 6 fo close hole weave in end front legs - make 2 in white 1 single_crochet 6 into magic_ring 2 increase around 12 3 increase single_crochet around 18 4 increase single_crochet 2 arounf 24 5 increase single_crochet 3 around 30 6-8 single_crochet around 3r of 30 9 decrease x6 single_crochet 18 24 10 decrease x6 single_crochet 12 18 11-19 single_crochet around slip_stitch into next fo leave tail for sewing 9r of 18 stuff making sure to get toe area stuffed well leave about a half inch of space at the top of the leg unstuffed use tail to sew top closed with the toes pointing forward cut additional strand of yarn paw color to stitch through/over toe area three times
